clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Analyze the Effect of Acupuncture on Mobility And Quality of Life in Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study to Analyze the Effect of Acupuncture on Mobility And Quality of Life in Multiple Sclerosis

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this two-center study is to examine the effectiveness of acupuncture treatments in addressing mobility deficits, sensorimotor impairment, and quality of life (QOL) limitations in persons with Multiple Sclerosis (MS). It is hypothesized that acupuncture will result in an improvement in these limitations.

primary_outcome.description: The Fatigue Severity Scale (FSS) is a method of evaluating the impact of fatigue. The FSS is a short questionnaire that requires patient to rate level of fatigue.

primary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study Pain Effects Scale
primary_outcome.description: The MOS covers pain severity in terms of intensity, frequency, and duration while recording the impact on behaviours and moods. MOS contains twelve self report items on the severity of pain over the past four weeks and its effect on mood and behaviours
Assesses distance walked over 6 minutes as a sub-maximal test of aerobic capacity/endurance
The T25-FW is a quantitative mobility and leg function performance test based on a timed 25-walk.

arm_group.description: Standard of Care (SOC) treatment will be based upon Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) interpretation of 4 phases of MS.
60-minute treatment session twice a week for three weeks

intervention.intervention_name: Standard of Care with no acupuncture
intervention.description: The control group will lie on a treatment table in the acupuncturist's office for the same amount of time that the treatment group did, but receive no acupuncture

The first set consists of core point selection, used in an MS Standard of Care (SOC). The second set of points will be individualized to the patient's needs as determined by the acupuncturist. SOC treatment will be based upon Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) interpretation of 4 phases of MS.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of MS
- ability to walk unaided for 6 minutes with or without assistive device
Exclusion Criteria:
- bleeding precautions
- trypanophobia
- inability to lie still for 30 minutes
- active cancer, current exacerbation, and history of previous acupuncture treatment
